head.title: Large Cache of Cocaine Found on Tanker

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Large Cache of Cocaine Found on Tanker

abstract.p: US Coast Guard reports one hundred twenty-five kilograms of cocaine is found near rudder of Liberian-flag hazardous-materials tanker in New York Harbor off Bay Street on Staten Island (S)

block.p: One hundred twenty-five kilograms of cocaine was found yesterday near the rudder of a large tanker in New York Harbor, the United States Coast Guard said.
Workers on a small boat repairing the tanker called the Coast Guard when they found a package in the vessel's rudder well. The package was found to contain cocaine, the Coast Guard said.
One hundred twenty-five kilograms of cocaine was found yesterday near the rudder of a large tanker in New York Harbor, the United States Coast Guard said.
Workers on a small boat repairing the tanker called the Coast Guard when they found a package in the vessel's rudder well. The package was found to contain cocaine, the Coast Guard said.

The repair vessel Twin Tubes had been working on the 593-foot Liberian-flag hazardous-materials tanker, which was anchored just off Bay Street on Staten Island north of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge, when they found the package, said Petty Officer Angelo Patti, a Coast Guard spokesman.

The tanker, the Timashevsk, was undergoing repairs to its propeller, which was damaged yesterday when the vessel hit a navigation buoy at the entrance to New York Harbor, Petty Officer Patti said. The Coast Guard discovered the cocaine about 11 a.m., he said.
The Coast Guard contacted the United States Customs Service and the Police Department, which are investigating, he said.
